result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Eugene Wyland

records.addlTxt: for documents, filed by WQOW News. Payment received and documents emailed 11/1/2022. olg
to: H.A.W.    check#: 033646   arc    Mailed this date.
filed by DA's Office, on behalf of VW. bph

** AMENDED **

-$1500.00 Bond on file.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- No possession of a firearm. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.L., Lindus Construction at 879 US Hwy 63, Baldwin, WI, and/or Employees, and 2196 160th Street, Milltown, WI ( Any personal belongings may be retrieved by H.W.) .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:05 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael Eugene Wyland in court. DE has PFAC. DE provided to Deputy. Court questions qualifying for PD office. Atty Schmidt to speak with DE. Recess 02:08 PM. Back on Record: 02:18 PM. Atty Schmidt states DE qualifies for PD. Unknown who may retain case. Court finds good cause to go beyond prelim time limits. Waive prelim time limits. Court sets STC. ADA Ellenwood requests bond modification. Court amends bond. $500.00 bond to be refunded to payor. Adjourned 02:26 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:38 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Michael Eugene Wyland in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
